title: Case Study on Online Collaborative Inquiry for Interdisciplinary Collaboration Competencies in Healthcare

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers simulate roles of various medical professionals and analyze cases using smartphone-based collaborative tools.

learning_goals: Learners can employ at least three effective communication strategies among interdisciplinary team members when analyzing medical cases.
Learners can complete role distribution and decision-making processes in a virtual interdisciplinary team project using online collaboration tools with over 80% proficiency.
Learners can propose practical solutions that integrate perspectives from experts in other fields to address complex medical-related problems.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
